intro: Noccaea albanica, commonly known as the Albanian honesty, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Noccaea albanica is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
